clustering_scheme.rationale: The model centers on contributor progression, supported by community participation (CoP) and the SECI knowledge spiral. Three clusters minimize crossings: a people pipeline, a mentoring/community dynamics module, and a knowledge creation/transfer module.

clusters.name: Contributor Development
clusters.theme: Movement of people through newcomer, experienced, and core roles, including promotion and attrition.

clusters.name: Community Dynamics & Mentoring
clusters.theme: Mentoring capacity, participation, cohesion, and attractiveness that shape legitimate peripheral participation.

clusters.name: Knowledge Creation & Transfer
clusters.theme: SECI spiral: tacit/explicit knowledge stocks and transformation processes that drive onboarding and advancement.

layout_hints: Place Contributor Development at the center; it is the main sink/source for cross-cluster links.
Position Knowledge Creation & Transfer on the left and Community Dynamics & Mentoring on the right.
Route the main people pipeline left-to-right: Join → New → Skill up → Experienced → Promotion → Core → Turnover.
Place Ba and Participation near the top of their clusters to shorten many incoming/outgoing lines.

theories.name: Communities of Practice (Wenger)
theories.rationale: The current model captures role progression and mentoring but omits legitimate peripheral participation dynamics (engagement, retention) and capacity constraints. Adding mentoring capacity, participation intensity, cohesion, and recruitment/retention flows operationalizes movement from periphery to core while accounting for social structure and load effects. This improves behavioral realism and creates leverage points for onboarding and retention.

variables.name: Newcomer Join Rate
variables.description: Rate at which newcomers join the project and enter the New Contributors stock.

variables.name: Newcomer Dropout Rate
variables.description: Rate at which newcomers disengage before becoming experienced.

variables.name: Experienced Attrition Rate
variables.description: Rate at which experienced contributors leave before promotion.

variables.name: Mentors
variables.description: Available mentors computed from Core Developer and Experienced Contributors.

variables.name: Mentoring Time Share
variables.description: Share of mentor time devoted to mentoring vs. other work.

variables.name: Mentoring Capacity
variables.description: Effective mentoring throughput given Mentors and Mentoring Time Share.

variables.name: Mentor-to-Newcomer Ratio
variables.description: Available mentors per newcomer; a key load indicator.

variables.name: Mentoring Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness of mentoring interactions as a function of Mentor-to-Newcomer Ratio.

variables.name: Participation Intensity
variables.description: Average engagement level of newcomers; boosts skill acquisition and retention.

variables.name: Community Cohesion
variables.description: Sense of mutual engagement and joint enterprise; reduces attrition and turnover.

variables.name: Project Attractiveness to Newcomers
variables.description: Perceived accessibility and supportiveness influencing newcomer joining.

theories.name: Nonaka's SECI Model
theories.rationale: Current elements mention implicit/explicit transfer but lack knowledge stocks and the four SECI processes. Adding explicit and tacit knowledge stocks with Socialization, Externalization, Combination, and Internalization processes creates a knowledge spiral that supports onboarding and promotion. Coupling Ba to these rates captures context effects; linking to participation and mentoring aligns people dynamics with knowledge creation.

variables.name: Project Explicit Knowledge
variables.description: Accumulated explicit knowledge (docs, guides, FAQs) usable by contributors.

variables.name: Externalization Rate
variables.description: Conversion of tacit to explicit knowledge (e.g., writing docs from experience).

variables.name: Combination Rate
variables.description: Synthesis/organization of existing explicit artifacts into more usable forms.

variables.name: Explicit Knowledge Decay Rate
variables.description: Obsolescence of documentation and explicit artifacts.

variables.name: Tacit Knowledge in Community
variables.description: Depth and distribution of tacit know-how across the community.

variables.name: Socialization Rate
variables.description: Tacit-to-tacit sharing through mentoring, pairing, reviews.

variables.name: Internalization Rate
variables.description: Absorption of explicit knowledge into personal tacit know-how.

variables.name: Tacit Knowledge Decay Rate
variables.description: Forgetting or loss of tacit knowledge as people churn or skills atrophy.

variables.name: Shared Context for Knowledge Creation (Ba)
variables.description: Quality of shared context enabling the SECI processes (tools, norms, spaces).
